Virtual Reality Application

This application was developed to answer the hypothesis "Does VR training have a practical application in aeronautical engineering?". The project conculded, although undetermined in answering the hypothesis due to lack of suitably qualified participants during the current lockdown restrictions, that VR increases memory retention over conventional teaching methods for technical terminology.

Published Website

BobbyJack's Hair Studio (due to current circumstances has ceased trading as of early 2021) was a unisex hairdresser in Sherborne, Dorset.

The site incorporates a main website with an admin page that is accessed via clicking on the word “BobbyJack’s” in the footer and was developed using HTML5, CSS Grid, JavaScript, PHP, PDO, and phpMyAdmin.

About

Hi, my name is Robert Hills, but known to my friends and collegues as Rob. I have always had a keen interest in all things computing, so decided (somewhat later in life than most) to fullfil a lifes ambition of obtaining a degree in something that I enjoy and want to make a career of. I have now finished my degree, obtaining a First Class BSc(hons) Applied Computing from the Universtiy of Bath.

The challenge presented on the course was welcomed and enjoyed, even through the frustration of something initially not doing what it was intended to do. The course covered a multitude of programming skills, such as, Database design (Oracle and MySql), Java (Android Applications and Multithreading), Web design and building (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, PHP), Game/VR Design (Unity and C#), Visual Basic, and Cyber Security (Basics and Forensics), utilising varied IDE's.

The majority of my career has been customer centric in sales and operational management roles, so understand the empathy and integrity required in maintaining solid customer relationships.

I realise there is much to learn and am now looking to further my understanding of programming with a goal of advancing into Cyber Security.
